definitions: person who behaves amorously without serious intent, often playfully
lighthearted behavior intended to arouse romantic or sexual interest
examples: She's such a flirt at every office party
The notorious flirt charmed everyone at the gathering
Their harmless flirt over coffee brightened her morning
A little flirt never hurt anyone at the dance

definitions: playful behavior intended to attract romantic or sexual interest without serious commitment
examples: Their flirtation lasted throughout the summer months
Office flirtation can sometimes lead to awkward situations

definitions: act of behaving amorously or playfully to attract romantic interest
examples: The flirting between them was obvious to everyone
Innocent flirting at the cafe made her smile

definitions: state or action of resting on water or air surface
business practice of allowing currency exchange rates to fluctuate freely
examples: The floating of logs downstream took several hours
Children enjoyed the floating of paper boats in puddles
The floating of the currency led to market instability
Experts debated the floating of government bonds this quarter

definitions: aircraft equipped with floats instead of wheels for water landing and takeoff
examples: The floatplane landed smoothly on the mountain lake
Remote villages depend on floatplane deliveries for supplies

definitions: group of birds, sheep, or goats that live, feed, or move together
congregation of people under the spiritual care of a pastor or priest
examples: A flock of geese flew overhead in perfect formation
The shepherd counted his flock before sunset each day
The pastor tended to his flock with dedication and care
Members of the flock gathered for Sunday morning service

definitions: act of beating someone with a whip or stick as punishment
examples: Public flogging was outlawed in most countries centuries ago
The historical novel described the brutal flogging of prisoners

definitions: overflow of water that submerges land which is usually dry
examples: Severe flooding destroyed hundreds of homes last spring
The annual flooding brings fertile soil to the farmland

definitions: area of low-lying ground adjacent to a river that is subject to flooding
examples: Building on the floodplain requires special permits and insurance
The fertile floodplain supports diverse wildlife and vegetation

definitions: material used to make or cover floors in buildings
examples: They chose hardwood flooring for the living room renovation
The contractor specialized in installing laminate flooring throughout homes

definitions: complete failure, especially in entertainment or business ventures
heavy, loose, or ungainly movement or fall
examples: The expensive movie turned out to be a complete flop
Their new product launch was a flop despite heavy marketing
He did a belly flop into the swimming pool
The fish gave one last flop before becoming still

definitions: flexible magnetic disk used for storing computer data, especially in older systems
examples: She found a box of old floppy disks in the attic
The ancient computer still required a floppy to boot up

definitions: plants of a particular region, habitat, or geological period collectively
examples: The desert flora has adapted to extreme temperature changes
Scientists catalog the flora and fauna of the rainforest

definitions: former British coin worth two shillings or various European gold or silver coins
examples: The antique florin was worth considerably more to collectors
Medieval merchants traded goods for florins across European markets

definitions: person who sells and arranges flowers and plants commercially
examples: The florist created beautiful bouquets for the wedding ceremony
She consulted with the florist about funeral flower arrangements

definitions: action of floating in liquid or gas
process of offering shares in a company to the public for the first time
examples: The life jacket ensures proper flotation in emergency situations
Scientists studied the flotation properties of various materials
The tech company's flotation raised millions in capital investment
Market conditions delayed the planned flotation until next quarter

definitions: fleet of ships or boats, especially small naval vessels
examples: A flotilla of fishing boats headed out at dawn
The naval flotilla patrolled the coastal waters vigilantly

definitions: wreckage or cargo found floating on the sea after a shipwreck
examples: Beachcombers searched the flotsam for valuable items after storms
The rescue team spotted flotsam from the missing vessel

definitions: marine flatfish with both eyes on one side of its head
act of struggling clumsily or helplessly
examples: The restaurant served fresh flounder with lemon butter sauce
Commercial fishing boats caught flounder in shallow coastal waters
His flounder through the deep snow exhausted him quickly
The company's flounder in the market continued for months

definitions: bold or extravagant gesture or action done for display
period of thriving, prosperity, or vigorous growth
examples: The magician ended his act with a dramatic flourish
She signed her name with an elegant flourish
The arts experienced a flourish during the Renaissance period
Small businesses enjoyed a flourish after the economic recovery

definitions: process or period when plants produce flowers
time when something reaches its peak or most successful development
examples: The flowering of cherry trees attracts thousands of tourists
Spring flowering fills the garden with color and fragrance
The flowering of democracy took decades to fully establish
This period marked the flowering of artistic expression

definitions: smooth continuous movement of liquid, gas, or other substances
examples: The flowing of the river carved deep canyons over millennia
Her dress had a beautiful flowing that caught everyone's attention

definitions: highly contagious viral infection affecting the respiratory system, short for influenza
examples: She missed work for a week due to severe flu
The flu vaccine helps prevent seasonal outbreaks each year

definitions: irregular rising and falling in number, amount, quality, or value
examples: Market fluctuation makes investment planning challenging for beginners
Temperature fluctuation can damage sensitive electronic equipment significantly

definitions: duct for smoke and waste gases from a fire, furnace, or boiler
examples: The chimney flue needs annual cleaning for safety reasons
Blocked flue caused dangerous carbon monoxide buildup inside

definitions: ability to speak or write a language easily, smoothly, and expressively
examples: Her fluency in three languages impressed the hiring committee
Reading daily improves fluency in any foreign language significantly

definitions: soft fibrous substance from fabric, plants, or feathers
entertainment or writing lacking serious content or substance
examples: She removed fluff from her sweater before the interview
The dryer filter was clogged with lint and fluff
The article was just fluff with no real information
Critics dismissed the movie as entertaining fluff without depth

definitions: brass musical instrument similar to a trumpet but with a wider, conical bore
examples: The jazz musician played a soulful solo on the flugelhorn
His flugelhorn produced warmer tones than a standard trumpet

definitions: physical property of a substance that enables it to flow
quality of being adaptable, changeable, or lacking fixed form
examples: The fluidity of mercury makes it useful in thermometers
Engineers tested the fluidity of various oil mixtures
The fluidity of modern work arrangements benefits many employees
Gender fluidity challenges traditional binary classification systems completely

definitions: unlikely chance occurrence, especially a lucky one
either of the two lobes of a whale's tail
parasitic flatworm that infects mammals and birds
examples: Winning the lottery was a complete fluke for him
Her discovery was no fluke but years of research
The whale's massive fluke slapped the ocean surface powerfully
Photographers captured the fluke disappearing beneath the waves
The veterinarian treated sheep infected with liver fluke
Laboratory tests confirmed the presence of fluke parasites

definitions: artificial channel conveying water for industrial use or entertainment
examples: The old mining flume still carries water down the mountain
Children screamed with delight on the water park flume

definitions: emission of light by a substance that has absorbed light or other electromagnetic radiation
examples: The fluorescence of certain minerals helps identify them under ultraviolet light
Scientists use fluorescence to track biological processes in living cells

definitions: electric light that produces light through fluorescence rather than heat
examples: The office replaced all fluorescent bulbs with LED alternatives
Fluorescent lighting can cause headaches in sensitive individuals

definitions: addition of fluoride to public water supplies to prevent tooth decay
examples: Community fluoridation has reduced cavities in children for decades
Some citizens opposed fluoridation citing health concerns and choice

definitions: compound containing fluorine, used especially to prevent tooth decay
examples: Dentists recommend fluoride toothpaste for cavity prevention in children
The water supply contains natural fluoride at safe levels

definitions: highly reactive, pale yellow gaseous element, the lightest member of the halogen group
examples: Fluorine forms compounds with almost all other chemical elements
Industrial processes use fluorine to create non-stick coating materials

definitions: selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor medication used to treat depression and anxiety disorders
examples: The doctor prescribed fluoxetine to help manage her depression
Patients taking fluoxetine should report any unusual side effects

definitions: light, brief shower of snow
sudden brief period of commotion, excitement, or busy activity
examples: A snow flurry dusted the cars with white powder
The weather forecast predicted occasional flurry throughout the day
A flurry of emails arrived after the announcement yesterday
The store experienced a flurry of customers before closing

definitions: temporary reddening of face and neck caused by emotion or fever
rush of water used for cleaning, especially in toilets
hand of cards all of the same suit in poker
examples: A flush of embarrassment colored her cheeks bright red
The fever caused a flush across his face and neck
The toilet flush mechanism needs repair by a plumber
One flush should clear the drain of all debris
Her royal flush won the entire poker tournament pot
Getting a flush requires all five cards matching suits

definitions: musical instrument consisting of a tube with holes along it
vertical groove or channel in architectural columns or other surfaces
examples: She practiced flute for hours before the concert performance
The silver flute produced clear, beautiful notes throughout range
The ancient column's flute added elegance to the temple
Craftsmen carved each flute with precision and artistic skill

definitions: person who plays the flute professionally or as a hobby
examples: The principal flutist led the woodwind section with expertise
Young flutist won first place in the music competition

definitions: quick, light flapping movement of wings or similar motion
abnormal rapid beating or pulsation of the heart
examples: The butterfly's flutter from flower to flower enchanted children
A flutter of excitement passed through the waiting crowd
The patient experienced heart flutter during the stress test
Atrial flutter requires immediate medical attention and treatment

definitions: continuous quick, light movements like those of wings or leaves
examples: The fluttering of curtains indicated an open window somewhere
Autumn leaves began their fluttering descent to the ground

definitions: continuous change, movement, or flow in a situation or substance
flow of a fluid, particles, or energy through a given surface
examples: Society remains in flux as technology rapidly advances worldwide
The company's leadership was in flux during the merger
Scientists measured the flux of solar radiation reaching Earth
Magnetic flux through the coil determines the induced voltage

definitions: small bird that catches insects in flight, found in various species worldwide
examples: The flycatcher perched patiently before darting after prey
Birdwatchers identified several flycatcher species during their forest walk

definitions: person who travels in an aircraft or pilots one
small handbill or leaflet used for advertising or announcements
examples: Frequent flyer miles accumulated quickly with her business travel
The nervous flyer gripped the armrest during turbulence
Students distributed flyer about the upcoming charity event
The colorful flyer advertised the grand opening sale

definitions: action or process of moving through air with wings or in an aircraft
examples: Her fear of flying prevented international vacation plans
The flying of military jets requires extensive training programs

definitions: bridge carrying one road or railway over another
flight of aircraft over a specific location for display or ceremony
examples: The new flyover reduced traffic congestion downtown significantly
Pedestrians used the flyover to cross the busy highway
The military flyover impressed spectators at the football game
Aircraft performed a ceremonial flyover honoring fallen veterans

definitions: flight route regularly used by migrating birds between breeding and wintering areas
examples: Conservation efforts protect wetlands along the Pacific flyway
Millions of birds follow this ancient flyway each spring
